javaslang.control

Class Match.Case<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaslang.control.Match.Case<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - result type of the Match.Case
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function<Object,R>, Match<R>
    Enclosing interface:
    Match<R>

    public static final class Match.Case<R>
extends Object
implements Match<R>
    A Match.Case which matches an Object by type or by value.

    Typically there is a chain of match cases. The first applicable match is applied to an object.

    The otherwise() methods provide a default value which is returned if no case matches.

    Since:
    1.0.0

      • otherwise

        public Match.Expression<R> otherwise(R defaultValue)

        Provides a default value which is returned if no case matches.

        Note that this method takes the default by value which means that the input is eagerly evaluated even if the otherwise clause of the expression is not executed. Unless you already have a default value calculated or as a literal it might be better to use the otherwise(Supplier) alternative to gain lazy evaluation.

        Parameters:
        defaultValue - The default value.
        Returns:
        a Match-expression

      • otherwise

        public Match.Expression<R> otherwise(Supplier<R> defaultSupplier)

        Provides a default value which is returned if no case matches.

        Parameters:
        defaultSupplier - A Supplier returning the default value.
        Returns:
        a Match-expression
